types.name: BuildSourceAPI
types.description: A build was triggered via an API

types.name: BuildSourceFrontend
types.description: A build was triggered manually via the frontend

types.name: BuildSourceWebhook
types.description: A build was triggered via a Webhook

fields.name: headers
fields.description: Provider specific headers sent along with the webhook. This will return null if the webhook has been purged by Buildkite.

fields.name: payload
fields.description: The body of the webhook. Buildkite only webhook data for a short period of time, so if this returns null - then the webhook data has been purged by Buildkite

fields.name: uuid
fields.description: The UUID for this webhook. This will return null if the webhook has been purged by Buildkite

types.name: JSON
types.description: A blob of JSON represented as a pretty formatted string

types.name: BuildSourceTriggerJob
types.description: A build was triggered via a trigger job

types.name: BuildSourceSchedule
types.description: A build was triggered via a schedule

types.name: Query
types.description: The query root for this schema

fields.name: agent
fields.description: Find an agent by it's slug

args.name: slug
args.description: The UUID for the agent, prefixed by it's organization's slug i.e. `acme-inc/0bd5ea7c-89b3-4f40-8ca3-ffac805771eb`

fields.name: agentToken
fields.description: Find an agent token by it's slug

args.name: slug
args.description: The UUID for the agent token, prefixed by it's organization's slug i.e. `acme-inc/0bd5ea7c-89b3-4f40-8ca3-ffac805771eb`

fields.name: apiAccessTokenCode
fields.description: Find a API Acccess Token code

args.name: code
args.description: The code provided by the Auth API

fields.name: artifact
fields.description: Find an artifact by it's UUID

fields.name: build
fields.description: Find a build by it's slug or UUID

args.name: slug
args.description: The number of the build, prefixed with it's organization and pipeline. i.e. `acme-inc/my-pipeline/123`

args.name: uuid
args.description: The UUID of the build

fields.name: job
fields.description: Find a build job by it's UUID

fields.name: node
fields.description: Fetches an object given its ID.

args.name: id
args.description: ID of the object.

fields.name: organization
fields.description: Find an organization by it's slug

args.name: slug
args.description: The organizations slug

fields.name: organizationInvitation
fields.description: Find an organization invitation via it's slug

args.name: slug
args.description: The UUID for the invitation, prefixed by it's organization's slug i.e. `acme-inc/0bd5ea7c-89b3-4f40-8ca3-ffac805771eb`

fields.name: organizationMember
fields.description: Find an organization membership via it's slug

args.name: slug
args.description: The UUID for the membership, prefixed by it's organization's slug i.e. `acme-inc/0bd5ea7c-89b3-4f40-8ca3-ffac805771eb`

fields.name: pipeline
fields.description: Find a pipeline by it's slug

args.name: slug
args.description: The slug of the pipeline, prefixed with it's organization. i.e. `acme-inc/my-pipeline`

fields.name: pipelineSchedule
fields.description: Find a pipeline schedule by it's slug

args.name: slug
args.description: The UUID for the pipeline schedule, prefixed by it's organization and pipeline's slug i.e. `acme-inc/my-pipeline/0bd5ea7c-89b3-4f40-8ca3-ffac805771eb`

fields.name: team
fields.description: Find a team by it's UUID

args.name: slug
args.description: The slug of the team, prefixed with it's organization. i.e. `acme-inc/awesome-team`

types.name: Viewer
types.description: Represents the current user session

fields.name: apiAccessTokens
fields.description: Returns the user's API access tokens. These are currently private and cannot be accessed via the public GraphQL API

args.name: template
args.description: Filter tokens by their template

args.name: organizations
args.description: Filter tokens by organizations they provide access to. Organizations are specified by their slug

fields.name: emails
fields.description: Emails associated with the current user

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the current user

fields.name: user
fields.description: The authenticated user

types.name: ID
types.description: Represents a unique identifier that is Base64 obfuscated. It is often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"VXNlci0xMA=="`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: User
types.description: A user

fields.name: builds
fields.description: Returns builds that this user has created.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The primary email for the user

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the user

fields.name: uuid
fields.description: The public UUID of the user

types.name: Avatar
types.description: An avatar belonging to a user

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL of the avavtar

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Metadata about a connection

types.name: Boolean
types.description: Represents `true` or `false` values.

types.name: Int
types.description: Represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Build
types.description: A build from a pipeline

args.name: first
args.description: Returns the first _n_ elements from the list.

args.name: after
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come after the specified cursor.

args.name: last
args.description: Returns the last _n_ elements from the list.

args.name: before
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come before the specified cursor.

fields.name: branch
fields.description: The branch for the build

fields.name: canceledAt
fields.description: The time when the build was cancelled

fields.name: canceledBy
fields.description: The user who canceled this build. If the build was canceled, and this value is null, then it was canceled automatically by Buildkite

fields.name: commit
fields.description: The commit for the build

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time when the build was created

fields.name: env
fields.description: Custom environment variables passed to this build

fields.name: finishedAt
fields.description: The time when the build finished

args.name: first
args.description: Returns the first _n_ elements from the list.

args.name: after
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come after the specified cursor.

args.name: last
args.description: Returns the last _n_ elements from the list.

args.name: before
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come before the specified cursor.

fields.name: message
fields.description: The message for the build

fields.name: number
fields.description: The number of the build

fields.name: rebuiltFrom
fields.description: The build that this build was rebuilt from

fields.name: scheduledAt
fields.description: The time when the build became scheduled for running

fields.name: source
fields.description: Where the build was created

fields.name: startedAt
fields.description: The time when the build started running

fields.name: state
fields.description: The current state of the build

fields.name: triggeredFrom
fields.description: The job that this build was triggered from

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL for the build

fields.name: uuid
fields.description: The UUID for the build

types.name: BuildStates
types.description: All the possible states a build can be in

enumValues.name: SKIPPED
enumValues.description: The build was skipped

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED
enumValues.description: The build has yet to start running jobs

enumValues.name: RUNNING
enumValues.description: The build is currently running jobs

enumValues.name: PASSED
enumValues.description: The build passed

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: The build failed

enumValues.name: CANCELING
enumValues.description: The build is currently being canceled

enumValues.name: CANCELED
enumValues.description: The build was canceled

enumValues.name: BLOCKED
enumValues.description: The build is blocked

enumValues.name: NOT_RUN
enumValues.description: The build wasn't run

fields.name: agentTokens

args.description: Filter tokens by whether they are revoked or not

args.name: search
args.description: Search agents for the given query terms case insensitively across name and meta data

args.description: Filter the agents to those only having the matching meta data

args.name: order
args.description: Order the invitations

fields.name: provider

fields.description: The git URL for this repository

types.name: DateTime
types.description: An ISO-8601 encoded UTC date string

types.name: Job
types.description: Kinds of jobs that can exist on a build

types.name: JobTypeCommand
types.description: A type of job that runs a command on an agent

fields.name: agent
fields.description: The agent that is running the job

fields.name: agentQueryRules
fields.description: The ruleset used to find an agent to run this job

fields.name: artifacts
fields.description: Artifacts uploaded to this job

fields.name: automaticArtifactUploadPaths
fields.description: A glob of files to automatically upload after the job finishes

fields.name: build
fields.description: The build that this job is a part of

fields.name: canceledAt
fields.description: The time when the job was cancelled

fields.name: command
fields.description: The command the job will run

fields.name: concurrency
fields.description: Concurrency information related to a job

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time when the job was created

fields.name: env
fields.description: Environment variables for this job

fields.name: exitStatus
fields.description: The exit status returned by the command on the agent

fields.name: finishedAt
fields.description: The time when the job finished

fields.name: label
fields.description: The label of the job

fields.name: pipeline
fields.description: The pipeline that this job is a part of

fields.name: scheduledAt
fields.description: The time when the job became scheduled for running

fields.name: startedAt
fields.description: The time when the job started running

fields.name: state
fields.description: The state of the job

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL for the job

fields.name: uuid
fields.description: The UUID for this job

types.name: JobStates
types.description: All the possible states a job can be in

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: The job has just been created and doesn't have a state yet

enumValues.name: WAITING
enumValues.description: The job is waiting on a `wait` step to finish

enumValues.name: WAITING_FAILED
enumValues.description: The job was in a `WAITING` state when the build failed

enumValues.name: BLOCKED
enumValues.description: The job is waiting on a `block` step to finish

enumValues.name: BLOCKED_FAILED
enumValues.description: The job was in a `BLOCKED` state when the build failed

enumValues.name: UNBLOCKED
enumValues.description: This `block` job has been manually unblocked

enumValues.name: UNBLOCKED_FAILED
enumValues.description: This `block` job was in a `BLOCKED` state when the build failed

enumValues.name: LIMITED
enumValues.description: The job is waiting for jobs with the same concurrency group to finish

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED
enumValues.description: The job is scheduled and waiting for an agent

enumValues.name: ASSIGNED
enumValues.description: The job has been assigned to an agent, and it's waiting for it to accept

enumValues.name: ACCEPTED
enumValues.description: The job was accepted by the agent, and now it's waiting to start running

enumValues.name: RUNNING
enumValues.description: The job is runing

enumValues.name: FINISHED
enumValues.description: The job has finished

enumValues.name: CANCELING
enumValues.description: The job is currently canceling

enumValues.name: CANCELED
enumValues.description: The job was canceled

enumValues.name: TIMING_OUT
enumValues.description: The job is timiing out for taking too long

enumValues.name: TIMED_OUT
enumValues.description: The job timed out

enumValues.name: SKIPPED
enumValues.description: The job was skipped

enumValues.name: BROKEN
enumValues.description: The jobs configuration means that it can't be run

types.name: JobConcurrency
types.description: Concurrency configuration for a job

fields.name: group
fields.description: The concurrency group

fields.name: limit
fields.description: The maximum amount of jobs in the concurrency that are allowed to run at any given time

types.name: Agent
types.description: An agent

fields.name: connectedAt
fields.description: The time when the agent connected to Buildkite

fields.name: connectionState
fields.description: The connection state of the agent

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date the agent was created

fields.name: disconnectedAt
fields.description: The time when the agent disconnected from Buildkite

fields.name: hostname
fields.description: The hostname of the machine running the agent

fields.name: ipAddress
fields.description: The IP address that the agent has connected from

fields.name: isDeprecated
fields.description: If this version of agent has been deprecated by Buildkite

fields.name: isRunningJob
fields.description: Returns whether or not this agent is running a job. If isRunningJob true, but the `job` field is empty, the current user doesn't have access to view the job

fields.name: job
fields.description: The currently running job

fields.name: jobs
fields.description: Jobs that the agent has run previously, excluding the current job

fields.name: lostAt
fields.description: The date the agent was lost from Buildkite if it didn't cleanly disconnect

fields.name: metaData
fields.description: The meta data this agent was stared with

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the agent

fields.name: operatingSystem
fields.description: The operating system the agent is running on

fields.name: pid
fields.description: The process identifier (PID) of the agent process on the machine

fields.name: pingedAt
fields.description: The last time the agent performend a `ping` operation to the Agent API

fields.name: priority
fields.description: The priority setting for the agent

fields.name: stoppedAt
fields.description: The time the agent was stopped by a user

fields.name: stoppedBy
fields.description: The user that stopped this agent

fields.name: userAgent
fields.description: The User-Agent of the program that is making Agent API requests to Buildkite

fields.name: uuid
fields.description: The public UUID for the agent

fields.name: version
fields.description: The version of the agent

types.name: OperatingSystem
types.description: A operating system that an agent can run on

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the operating system

types.name: AgentPermissions
types.description: Permissions information about what actions the current user can do against this agent

fields.name: agentDelete
fields.description: Whether the user can manually delete this agent (only available to legacy agents)

fields.name: agentStop
fields.description: Whether the user can stop the agent remotely

types.name: Permission
types.description: The result of checking a permissions

types.name: Node
types.description: An object with an ID.

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID of the object.

types.name: Artifact
types.description: A file uploaded from the agent whilst running a job

fields.name: job
fields.description: The job that uploaded this artifact

fields.name: mimeType
fields.description: The mime type of the file provided by the agent

fields.name: path
fields.description: The path of the uploaded artifact

fields.name: sha1sum
fields.description: A SHA1SUM of the file

fields.name: size
fields.description: The size of the file in bytes that was uploaded

fields.name: state
fields.description: The upload state of the artifact

fields.name: uuid
fields.description: The public UUID for this artifact

types.name: JobTypeBlock
types.description: A type of job that requires a user to unblock it before proceeding in a build pipeline

fields.name: build
fields.description: The build that this job is a part of

fields.name: isUnblockable
fields.description: Whether or not this job can be unblocked yet (may be waiting on another job to finish)

fields.name: label
fields.description: The label of this block step

fields.name: state
fields.description: The state of the job

fields.name: unblockedAt
fields.description: The time when the job was created

fields.name: unblockedBy
fields.description: The user that unblocked this job

fields.name: uuid
fields.description: The UUID for this job

types.name: JobTypeWait
types.description: A type of job that waits for all previous jobs to pass before proceeding the build pipeline

fields.name: build
fields.description: The build that this job is a part of

fields.name: state
fields.description: The state of the job

fields.name: uuid
fields.description: The UUID for this job

types.name: JobTypeTrigger
types.description: A type of job that triggers another build on a pipeline

fields.name: build
fields.description: The build that this job is a part of

fields.name: state
fields.description: The state of the job

fields.name: triggered
fields.description: The build that this job triggered

fields.name: uuid
fields.description: The UUID for this job

types.name: JobTypes
types.description: All the possible types of jobs that can exist

enumValues.name: COMMAND
enumValues.description: A job that runs a command on an agent

enumValues.name: WAIT
enumValues.description: A job that waits for all previous jobs to finish

enumValues.name: BLOCK
enumValues.description: A job that blocks a pipeline from progressing until it's manually unblocked

enumValues.name: TRIGGER
enumValues.description: A job that triggers another build on a pipeline

types.name: PipelineMetric
types.description: A metric for a pipeline

fields.name: label
fields.description: The label of this metric

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL for this metric

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value for this metric

types.name: PipelineSchedule
types.description: A schedule of when a build should automatically triggered for a Pipeline

fields.name: branch
fields.description: The branch to use for builds that this schedule triggers. Defaults to to the default branch in the Pipeline

fields.name: builds
fields.description: Returns the builds created by this schedule

fields.name: commit
fields.description: The commit to use for builds that this schedule triggers. Defaults to `HEAD`

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time when this schedule was created

fields.name: cronline
fields.description: A definition of the trigger build schedule in cron syntax

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: If this Pipeline schedule is currently enabled

fields.name: env
fields.description: Environment variables passed to any triggered builds

fields.name: failedAt
fields.description: The time when this schedule failed

fields.name: failedMessage
fields.description: If the last attempt at triggering this scheduled build fails, this will be the reason

fields.name: label
fields.description: A short description of the Pipeline schedule

fields.name: message
fields.description: The message to use for builds that this schedule triggers

fields.name: nextBuildAt
fields.description: The time when this schedule will create a build next

fields.name: uuid
fields.description: The UUID of the Pipeline schedule

types.name: PipelineSchedulePermissions
types.description: Permission information about what actions the current user can do against the pipeline schedule

fields.name: pipelineScheduleDelete
fields.description: Whether the user can delete the schedule

fields.name: pipelineScheduleUpdate
fields.description: Whether the user can update the schedule

types.name: PipelinePermissions

fields.name: buildCreate

fields.name: pipelineDelete

fields.name: pipelineFavorite
fields.description: Whether the user can favorite this pipeline

fields.name: pipelineScheduleCreate
fields.description: Whether the user can create schedules on this pipeline

fields.name: pipelineUpdate
fields.description: Whether the user can edit the settings of this pipeline

types.name: TeamSelector
types.description: A Team identifier using a slug, and optionally negated with a leading `!`

types.name: PipelineOrders
types.description: The diferent orders you can sort pipelines by

enumValues.name: NAME
enumValues.description: Order by name alphabetically

enumValues.name: NAME_WITH_FAVORITES_FIRST
enumValues.description: Order by favorites first alphabetically, then the rest of the pipelines alphabetically

enumValues.name: RECENTLY_CREATED
enumValues.description: Order by the most recently created pipelines first

enumValues.name: RELEVANCE
enumValues.description: Order by relevance when searching for pipelines

fields.name: revokedReason

types.name: OrganizationMember
types.description: A member of an organization

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time when this user was added to the organization

fields.name: createdBy
fields.description: The user that added invited this user

fields.name: pipelines
fields.description: Pipelines the user has access to within the organization

args.name: first
args.description: Returns the first _n_ elements from the list.

args.name: after
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come after the specified cursor.

args.name: last
args.description: Returns the last _n_ elements from the list.

args.name: before
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come before the specified cursor.

args.name: search
args.description: Search within the pipelines the user has access to

args.name: order
args.description: Order the pipelines returned

fields.name: role
fields.description: The users role within the organization

fields.name: teams
fields.description: Teams that this user is a part of within the organization

args.name: order
args.description: Order the members returned

fields.name: uuid
fields.description: The public UUID for this organization member

types.name: OrganizationMemberRole
types.description: The roles a user can be within an organization

enumValues.name: MEMBER
enumValues.description: The user is a regular member of the organization

enumValues.name: ADMIN
enumValues.description: Has full access to the entire organization

types.name: OrganizationMemberPipeline
types.description: Represents the connection between a user an a pipeline within an organization

fields.name: pipeline

enumValues.name: RECENTLY_CREATED

types.name: OrganizationInvitation
types.description: A pending invitation to a user to join this organization

fields.name: acceptedAt
fields.description: The time when the invitation was accepted

fields.name: acceptedBy
fields.description: The user that accepted this invite

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time when the invitation was created

fields.name: createdBy
fields.description: The user that added invited this email address

fields.name: email
fields.description: The email address of this invitation

fields.name: expiredAt
fields.description: The time when the invitation was automatically expired

fields.name: revokedAt
fields.description: The time when this invitation was revoked

fields.name: revokedBy
fields.description: The user that revoked this invitation

fields.name: role
fields.description: The role the user will have in the organization once they've accepted the invitation

fields.name: slug
fields.description: The slug of the invitation that can be used to find an invitation in the query root

fields.name: state
fields.description: The current state of the invitation

fields.name: teams
fields.description: Teams that have been assigned to this invitation

args.name: first
args.description: Returns the first _n_ elements from the list.

fields.name: uuid
fields.description: The UUID of the invitation

types.name: OrganizationInvitationStates
types.description: All the possible states that an organization invitation can be

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: The invitation is waiting for a user to accept it

enumValues.name: ACCEPTED
enumValues.description: The invitation was accepted by the person it was sent to

enumValues.name: EXPIRED
enumValues.description: The invitation wasn't accepted and the link has expired

enumValues.name: REVOKED
enumValues.description: The invitation was revoked and can no longer be accepted

types.name: OrganizationInvitationTeamAssignment
types.description: A team that has been assigned to an invitation

fields.name: role
fields.description: The role that the user will have once they've accepted the invite

fields.name: organizationInvitationRevoke

types.name: Annotation
types.description: An annotation allows you to add arbitary content to the top of a build page in the Buildkite UI

fields.name: body
fields.description: The body of the annotation

fields.name: context
fields.description: The context of the annotation that helps you differentiate this one from others

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date the annotation was created

fields.name: style
fields.description: The visual style of the annotation

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The last time the annotation was changed

fields.name: uuid
fields.description: The public UUID for this annotation

types.name: AnnotationStyle
types.description: The visual style of the annoation

enumValues.name: DEFAULT
enumValues.description: The default styling of an annotation

enumValues.name: SUCCESS
enumValues.description: The annotation has a green border with a tick next to it

enumValues.name: INFO
enumValues.description: The annotation has a blue border with an information icon next to it

enumValues.name: WARNING
enumValues.description: The annotation has an orange border with a warning icon next to it

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.description: The annotation has a red border with a cross next to it

types.name: AnnotationBody
types.description: A body of an annotation

fields.name: html
fields.description: The body of the annotation rendered as HTML. The renderer result could be an empty string if the textual version has unsupported HTML tags

fields.name: text
fields.description: The body of the annotation as text

fields.description: A description of the application

fields.description: The name of this application

types.description: A code that is used by an API Application to request an API Access Token

fields.name: authorizedAt
fields.description: The time when this code was authorized by a user

fields.name: authorizedIPAddress
fields.description: The IP address of the client that authorized this code

fields.description: The description of the code provided by the API Application

fields.name: expiresAt
fields.description: The time when this code will expire

types.name: Mutation
types.description: The root for mutations in this schema

fields.name: apiAccessTokenCodeAuthorize
fields.description: Authorize an API Access Token Code generated by an API Application. Please note this mutation is private and cannot be executed externally.

fields.name: emailCreate
fields.description: Create an email for the current user

fields.name: emailResendVerification
fields.description: Resends a verification email

fields.name: noticeDismiss
fields.description: Dismisses a notice from the Buildkite UI. This mutation is idempotent so if you dismiss the same notice multiple times, it will return the original `dismissedAt` time

fields.name: organizationInvitationResend
fields.description: Resends an organization invitation

fields.name: organizationInvitationRevoke
fields.description: Revokes an organization invitation so it can no longer be accepted

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
